description: T4552	Acer cappadocicum (Caucasian Maple)PRS	Prune from adjacent structure	to clear lamp column by 1 m.T4514	Robinia pseudoacacia (False Acacia sp./Black Locust)PRS	Prune from adjacent structure	to clear lamp column by 1 m.T4631	Platanus x hispanica (London Plane)R00	Reduce crown by -  Specified extent	reduce the three heavily weighted, extended limbs to the east and southeast overhanging the children's playground, by around 2.5 m, due to heavy extension growth observed and to prevent failure due to a change in the crown/ wind dynamics, following the reduction of the adjacent tree with a conjoined crown. Final cuts to be no greater than 100 mm diameter, leaving furnishing growth to minimise visual impact.T4530	Platanus x hispanica (London Plane)R00	Reduce crown by -  Specified extent	due to high number of Massaria affected branches shedding onto High target area (gardeners yard), reduce all extended lateral limbs by 2.5 - 3 m in the lower, mid and upper outer sections of the crown, tapering in to meet the current top centre of the crown, leaving a natural and balanced shape. All internal crown epicormic growth should be retained and final cuts are to be made at suitable pruning points, leaving furnishing growth to minimise visual impact wherever possible. See photos of extended limbs and recently failed branch.T7481	Aesculus x carnea (Red Horse Chestnut)RBW	Reduce heavy branch weight	reducing the main terminal section of the subdominant stem/ limb to the west attached at 4 m by approximately 2.5 m, to prevent failure onto pedestrians, due to it being heavily suppressed and extended over the footpath. The secondary branches growing from the limb should be lightly pruned by up to 1.5 m to balance the shape of the crown an produce a natural aesthetic. Final cuts to be made at suitable pruning points, leaving furnishing growth to minimise visual impact.T4529	Platanus x hispanica (London Plane)RS00	Reduce faulted stem / stems by - Specified extent	(ste...
